Name: Osthole
Description: Osthole is a member of coumarins and a botanical anti-fungal agent. It has a role as a metabolite.

plant_concentrations.References: (1) Beom Kim S et al; Pharm Biol 54: 1373-9 (2016) (2) Matsuda H et al; Biol Pharm Bull 25: 809-12 (2002) (3) Sajjadi SE et al; Res Pharm Sci 11: 324-31 (2016)
plant_concentrations.Value: Osthole is a major coumarin found in the fruit of Cnidium monnieri Cusson (Umbelliferae)(1). Dried Cnidii Monnieri Fructus, purchased from Osaka, China in 1999 contained osthole(2). Osthole was found in the fruit of Prangos asperula, harvested Jul 2011 from Dena Mountains, west of Iran(3).

Bioassay guided fractionation of an antimycobacterial extract of Arracacia tolucensis var. multifida (Umbelliferae) led to the isolation of isoimperatorin (1), osthol (2), suberosin (3), 8-methoxypsoralen (8-MOP) (4), herniarin (5), scoparone (6), umbelliferone (7), dihydroxypeucedanin (8), 5-methoxypsoralen (5-MOP) (9), isoscopoletin (10) and scopoletin (11).

plant_concentrations.References: (1) US Dept Agric; US Dept Agric, Agric Res Service. 1992-2018. Dr. Duke's Phytochemical and Ethnobotanical Databases. Osthole. Available from, as of Jan 10, 2019: https://phytochem.nal.usda.gov/phytochem/search
